contentList.content: I'm looking forward to it. It'll be fun.
See what I mean? Awful.
You know, I never pictured myself as a hero.
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the tiefling.
True, I'd rather lie with them.
Living in constant peril isn't exciting enough for you?
Do you think Wyll would approve? I saw how he looked at you earlier.
That had better not mean 'I want to kill something'.
No, absolutely not.
I hope you're not here to beg. It's so unbecoming.
Leave.
I just hope she leaves you in one piece. We can't take a tenday for you to recover from whatever her idea of 'fun' is.
*It's a heavy, rich red - dry and sharp.*
I mean, can you imagine? Urgh. No.
But what do I get for all my hard work? A pat on the head and vinegar for wine.
And what's your idea of 'a little fun'?
Watch, maybe, but never intrude.
It's easy for some, of course. You and Karlach seem to be getting on very well.
It's easy for some. I see Lae'zel's marked you as her territory.
You did a good thing. Suck it up and enjoy yourself.
Well, that'd certainly spice up this evening.
I don't know what her idea of a good time is, but it seems to involve you. I'd hate to intrude.
It's just sex. Nothing serious.
Never thought I'd be the one they toast for saving so many lives. And now that I'm here...
Living in constant peril isn't exciting enough for you?
True, the goblins would have thrown a wilder party.
True. That was fun.
Relax, all your problems will still be there in the morning.
Don't be so sour. I like a good time as much as anyone.
What?
It's easy for some. You and Shadowheart seem to have a connection. It looks very sweet.
Really? Saving lives is awful?
Interested in sharing a bed tonight?
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Wyll.
Cheeky little pup. I'll see you later.
Let's wait until things quieten down. Once the others are asleep, we'll find each other.
Say 'please'.
Still, I would've liked more for my trouble than a pat on the head and vinegar for wine.
That's a 'no' to fun, then?
We could have fun? We could spend some 'quality time' together.
Take his bottle and try the wine.
Will you now? Don't take too long. You're not the only tasty morsel here.
It's none of my business, of course. I wouldn't want to intrude.
It's not that bad. Think of all the goblins you killed.
No, Astarion. It's not happening.
Anyway, don't let me keep you. I'm sure you have someone else to sniff around.
Indeed you will, my love. Indeed you will.
I'm not sure. Let me get back to you.
By the hells. Sex. Passion. Fun.
Maybe. If you say 'please.'
You're eager, aren't you? But we need to wait a little longer.
A bed and so much more.
All right, but don't take too long. You're not the only tasty morsel around here.
Serious or not, it's something.
You are an insolent little pup, aren't you?
I'm just looking for a little more excitement. A little more fun.
Cheeky. I'll see you then.
I'm kidding. Once everyone's asleep, I'll find you and we can have some fun.
Funny, but unbecoming.
Never listen to your second thoughts. They always spoil the fun.
Do you mind? I'm very busy.
Not at all! I was hoping for companionship and - well, maybe a little death. Figuratively speaking.
We killed some goblins to save some tieflings. The tally of lives didn't change much.
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the walking encyclopaedia.
I'm flattered, but I think not. It's not you, you understand, it's me.
It's easy for some, of course. You and Wyll seem to be getting on very well.
I'm sure it'll be adequate.
By all means, go and enjoy yourself.
Ha! No, my love, you and Shadowheart can get up to whatever you want. It means nothing to me.
All I want is a little fun. Is that so much to ask?
All right, let's do it. I'll see you later.
Good boy! Let's get together tonight.
Thank you so much for telling me. Now please do piss off.
You know, we could always make our own entertainment, darling. Get a little closer, so to speak.
Knowing you, it probably is.
Do you think Lae'zel would approve? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
On second thoughts, maybe not.
Knowing you, it probably is.
Do you think Shadowheart would approve? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
Leave.
But fine. If you're determined to ruin your evening, I won't stop you.
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Karlach.
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Shadowheart.
You're not jealous, are you?
No, I wouldn't want to get in the middle of whatever that is. We'll end tonight as friends.
Ha! No, I've seen enough blades in my time.
Feeling jealous, are you?
Are you looking forward to seeing his 'Blade of Frontiers'? I hope it's more greatsword than dagger.
Whinge all you want - I'm having fun.
Maybe. I'll think about it.
Not with you, just to be clear.
I'll be here, waiting for the sunrise.
Are you now? Well, lucky him.
I'd rather bed a goblin, darling.
Not what I'd call 'passionate', or 'interesting', but sweet.
But you go ahead. Have fun.
Do you think Karlach would approve? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
Ha! No. If he had an incubus instead of that cambion? That might be a different story.
But have it your way. I'm happy to entertain myself.
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the beating our gith friend will give you.
I'd hate to get between the gith and her trophy. No, I think we'll end this evening as friends.
Do you think Gale would approve? I saw how he looked at you earlier.
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Lae'zel.
It's easy for some, of course. You and Gale seem to be getting on very well.
Enjoy myself? There's a worm in my brain, hunters on my trail, and all I've got to drink is wine that tastes like vinegar.
Please.
By the hells. Sex, my dear. A night of passion.
Enjoy myself? There's a worm in my brain, I'm surrounded by idiots, and all I've got to drink is wine that tastes like vinegar.
Are you now? Well, lucky her.
You insolent little-
I hate it. This is awful.
We could have fun? We could spend some 'quality time' together.
I have standards.
Fine. Enjoy your night with whatever beast will have you.
That means I have to survive tonight. And this party.
And here I mistook you for someone with taste. A pity.
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Gale.
Having fun yet?
Nothing so dramatic. Just you and me and - well, maybe a little death? Figuratively speaking.
Once everyone's in their bedrolls, we'll slip out of ours and find each other.
No.
I wonder if he uses magic in the bedroom? That could go very well or very badly.
Are you offering something better? Because I could be persuaded...
If you're looking for another shot, I'm afraid you've missed it.
Interested in sharing a bed tonight?
Don't you love the silence after a massacre? It's just so pure.
So, given that we are fresh out of alcohol for you, what shall we get up to?
So, I see you and Shadowheart have a connection. It looks very sweet.
You're not jealous, are you?
I'm guessing you have something in mind.
Leave.
Really? I thought you had other company planned this evening, and I'd hate to intrude.
Never listen to your second thoughts! They always spoil the fun.
It's nothing serious.
Does Lae'zel know that? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
So, I see Lae'zel's marked you as her territory.
No, I'll spend the night alone.
Let's wait until things quieten down a bit. Once the others are asleep, we'll find each other.
Not that I'm judging, of course.
Maybe. If you say 'please.'
I wish things had turned out differently.
I'm afraid I'm all out. This party is more humble than I'd like.
If you're here to beg forgiveness, save your breath. My cup and I are perfectly happy together.
Although you're doing well enough on your own. I saw how the drow looked at you.
To surviving!
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the beating our gith friend will give you.
Say 'please'.
That's not funny.
As for me, I'm going to drink until I know I won't hear you grunting in the bushes.
You're a conquering hero and you want to drink foaming piss?
So, what are we drinking to? Other than a pile of corpses.
No.
What do you mean?
Try it. You might have fun.
Red.
I don't know what her idea of a good time is, but it seems to involve you. I'd hate to intrude.
To fun!
And I wish I was drinking out of the skulls of everyone who's ever wronged me. Life is tough.
Well hello. Welcome to my humble party.
We whip each other within an inch of our lives.
I'm afraid it's warm, but needs must.
To victory, of course.
Although I'm sure you'd know better than I would.
So, I see you and the drow have been making eyes at each other.
Well hello. What's on your mind?
Leave.
Suit yourself. I've more than enough company.
Well, I'd hate to get in the way of a well-laid plan. So to speak.
But fine. If you're determined to ruin your evening, I won't stop you.
I have to admit, I wish I could share a bed with you tonight.
What would you like to happen?
Not what I'd call 'fun', or 'interesting', but sweet.
There's no better way to unwind after a long day of killing.
I can replace those brutal fantasies of yours with desires you'll find much harder to push away.
Indeed you will, my love. Indeed you will.
I have standards.
I'd rather bed one of the goblins, darling.
Certainly better than pillow talk with your drow lover, hmm?
White.
Are you offering anything better? Because I could be persuaded...
I'm sorry, I mistook you for someone with taste.
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Shadowheart.
Oh don't be so sour - it's a party.
Interested in sharing a bed tonight?
Ha! You're braver than I thought.
Although that's not to say we can't have a little fun.
Interested in sharing a bed tonight?
Watch maybe, but not intrude.
You insolent little-
Ha! No, my love, you and Shadowheart can hold hands all you want. It means nothing to me.
I'll see you later, then.
Interested in sharing a bed tonight?
I'd hoped to get close to you, but I don't want to light you on fire.
Really? Her?
By the hells. Sex, my dear! Or whatever you can manage given your... situation.
By the hells. Sex, my dear. A night of passion.
Come on. There's a spark here. I know you've felt it too, darling.
There isn't. I haven't. And that's all there is to it.
Does the drow know that? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
Cheeky little pup. I'll see you later.
Be careful with that one. Her idea of a good time probably involves biting your head off halfway through the act.
Well, I'd planned to bed you...
Are you now? Well, lucky her.
I just hope she leaves you in one piece. We can't take a tenday for you to recover from whatever her idea of 'fun' is.
So, has anyone in the camp caught your eye?
Well, I'd had my heart set on bedding you.
I'm kidding. I'll see you tonight.
To victory!
Although you're doing well enough on your own. I see you and Shadowheart have a connection. It looks very sweet.
Well done! I'll see you tonight.
I'm flattered, but I think not. It's not you, you understand, it's me.
Not quite yet, love. Let's wait until they're asleep.
To surviving another day.
What?
What would you like to happen?
I'm tempted by Lae'zel.
I'm not ashamed. I just don't feel like boasting about it.
And I wish I was drinking out of Cazador's skull. Life is tough.
Do you mind? I have a bottle to finish.
Please, don't count me out just because of your condition. I'm always up for a challenge.
I'll give you red.
I'm sure I'll have a good time.
Interested in sharing a bed tonight?
I bet Minthara is fun.
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the drow. You have all the fun you want - if you survive the night.
Does Shadowheart know that? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
A bed and so much more.
To getting rid of this tadpole.
Ha! No, it so rarely is. But it might be fun.
What are you drinking?
So. What happens next?
But have it your way. I'm happy to entertain myself.
Ah, a good, full-bodied choice.
I'd hoped to get close to you, but I don't want to light you on fire.
Here's to you!
Oh, a little talking, a little drinking, and - once everyone else is asleep - we get to know each other.
Beer, if you have it.
You did what you had to. Don't be ashamed that you did it well.
On second thought, maybe we'd better not.
What's your poison? I have - ah.
What do you mean?
How about some rest? It's been quite an evening.
Well, you have fun. I'm more than happy with my cup anyway.
Oh don't come crawling back. It's just embarrassing.
I'm sure she is. If you can trust her not to bite your head off once you've done the deed.
Nothing.
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with our drow host.
Although you're doing well enough on your own. I see Lae'zel's marked you as her territory.
Please.
Ha! All right, to a mountain of corpses!
No, Astarion. It's not happening.
I'd hate to get between the gith and her trophy. No, I think we'll end this evening as friends.
Between us? Nothing.
I have to admit, I wish I could share a bed with you tonight.
Nothing? How can you be so cruel?
Fine. Enjoy your night with whatever goblin will have you.
Your funeral.
Cheeky little pup. I'll see you later.
It was more a mountain of corpses than a pile...
Just so you know, I'm spending tonight with Lae'zel.
Shadowheart is looking very good tonight...
Well, I'd planned to bed you...
Good for you. As for me, I'm going to drink until I'm sure I won't hear you grunting in the bushes.
She does seem like a fun romp. As long as she doesn't bite your head off halfway through the act.
What's your poison? Red? White?
Just water.
Mmm. Delicious.
Maybe. If you say 'please.'
Cheers.
Whatever makes you happy, I suppose. As long as you don't come scratching at my door.
You are an insolent little pup, aren't you?
What do you mean?
Well, I'd planned to bed you...
Perhaps not.
We must not forget this night. True allies are few.
I made my choice, Lae'zel.
Celebrate now. Come dawn, we depart.
Are you asking me for sex?
A loathsome hurdle. Watching you burn lit a fire in me I could not quench alone.
I respect your error.
A pity for us you have promised your night to Gale.
Bah - think if you must. The chance will pass come light of day.
I smell their blood on you still. I smell your sweat.
Vlaakith demands of me no less.
There are, after all, other spreads before me. Astarion looks particularly tempting tonight.
Come morning, you will wonder.
But come morning, you will wonder.
Oh, but do enjoy yourself this night. I intend to, myself.
Yes.
Yes. Let our pleasure honour Vlaakith.
Then taste it. I want you in my bed tonight.
A pity for us you have promised your night to the half-elf.
Soon. When you rest, I will come.
You will wonder how my lips might have tasted, how my fingers on your skin might have felt.
For now.
A night such as this calls for flesh to feast on. And I have chosen the sweetest.
I will do no such thing - not when you have turned your back on me so often.
I will have to seek relief elsewhere.
A pity for us both you've turned your back on me so often.
A lesson taught in flesh and bone this very night. Associate as you wish. Avert your eyes at your peril.
How torturous for us both that I'll never get a taste.
Yet they could not match your nerve today. It was enough to drive me to madness.
I've no doubt she will satisfy your tastes for endless conversation.
You are a gifted warrior. It was pleasure enough to fight at your side.
You are a gifted warrior. It was pleasure enough to fight at your side.
A lesson you might have heeded, had your flesh not been weak.
There are, after all, other spreads before me.
One day, fortune may favour you.
I will take pleasure when I wish, and from whom I wish.
A glorious reward for a glorious battle.
Go on, have your fun. And do not wipe away a single bead of sweat. It's intoxicating.
Mm. You have given in.
Leave.
A pity for us you have promised your body to Astarion.
Given our history, I can't believe you're asking. And I can't believe I'm saying 'yes'...
Perhaps.
Leave.
Too bad for us both your bunk will be quite busy. Take all the pleasures you can, before dawn brings their end.
I smell their blood on you still. I smell your moisture.
I've no doubt he will satisfy your tastes for endless conversation.
I will not go long without pleasure.
If only you'd earned the right to lay at my side.
I have seen the kith'raki tear a screaming neogi's legs from its belly to fashion into blades.
Vlaakith demands of me no less.
Yes, I must have you tonight.
I hope for your sake he doesn't come too near your neck.
You know the fortune of my company.
To think you might have known paradise.
No, I'm sorry. I don't see you as an intimate partner.
I smell their blood on you still. I'd have liked to have tasted it.
When you lie down for the night, I will come.
Another fortune yet stands before you. A warrior's flesh, rarely tasted.
I'd love nothing more, but I'm afraid I can't touch anyone until my engine is fixed.
That's fine - I'm not interested anyway.
Mm - if only I might lay claim to my proper trophy.
Celebrate now. Come dawn, we depart.
I will take pleasure when I wish, and from whom I wish. Astarion looks particularly tempting tonight.
I'd love to share my bed with you tonight.
I can hardly believe my own words, but - perhaps another night?
Maybe another night? It could be sweeter for waiting.
So you say.
And I will take what is mine.
A pity for us you have promised your night to the drow.
Yes.
You are a gifted warrior. It was pleasure enough to fight at your side.
Celebrate now. Come dawn, we depart.
Oh, but do enjoy yourself this night. I intend to, myself. Astarion looks particularly tempting.
Of all people, you set your sights on me? I'll have to think about it.
I'll think about it.
Associate as you wish. Indulge yourself at your own peril.
Strange at seems with all that's happened between us, you might still persuade me to your bed.
You might still persuade me to share the night with you instead.
A pity indeed. Maybe we can make amends some other night?
'Turn your back not to your ally, lest you would see it pierced.' So Vlaakith has taught us.
'Turn your back not to your ally, lest you would see it pierced.' A githyanki dictum.
I mean to taste it.
Sex.
In fact, I prefer the wine to your blind stabs at mockery. Get away from me.
I'm surprised she hasn't dragged you off to rut already.
I serve the Lady of Loss. We stripped those tieflings of hope itself.
Maybe if I down enough of this swill, it'll pickle the worm in my skull.
Get a girl's hopes up, why don't you? I need another bottle.
We set a pack of refugees on fire. A child could have done it.
But I appreciate the thought.
Shouldn't you be in someone else's bedroll by now?
He does seem like the decadent type.
Unless you meant to raise my spirits by other means?
The goblins stole good wine. It goes straight to the head.
You sure know how to keep a party interesting.
*But now an ill, twisting feeling lingers in her gut. One that has nothing to do with the wine.*
But that... doesn't sound half bad.
And you're carousing with Lae'zel.
Aren't you excited? We won.
Maybe... but I know better than to share my bed drunk.
Why did killing those tieflings make me feel sick?
Not that I'm judging. I have this.
Not interested in Astarion's leftovers, I'm afraid.
We could sit by the fire?
My goddess smiles on such bloodshed.
Leave.
No more war tonight, I think.
You just... you! Get away from me. Now.
...It's all disgusting.
The corpses probably do something extra for him, don't they?
*Shadowheart's mind is drenched in drink and confusion. She's killed before - enjoyed it, even.*
Push into her thoughts.
I prefer to keep a few things secret. It's old habit.
Well, I don't find you entertaining in the least.
You look guilty. Tormented.
The fire's nice. I'll stay here a while.
And you're carousing with Astarion.
I've killed in her name before. Why now? Why isn't the wine helping?
You're the one becoming! Disgusting...
Leave.
Would you like a better distraction?
Not interested in a gith's leftovers, I'm afraid.
Just... let me enjoy a drink in peace.
It's awkward for me too, you know.
Not interested in Minthara's leftovers, I'm afraid.
Makes me wonder if you treat all your lovers that harshly.
And you're carousing with Minthara.
I'd prefer the quiet, if it's all the same to you.
You could share what's on your mind - if you want.
Certainly not. I find your misery amusing.
Entertain yourself elsewhere.
*Your head swims, nausea burning in your gut.*
Thank you. The offer's kind, but it's not a kindness I can afford.
Pull yourself together. Your behaviour is unbecoming.
Guilty? Ridiculous. What's there to be guilty for?
At least you've spared them the hangover tomorrow.
I'm not sure what to say. I've never done any of this... comforting.
Will your magic to pierce Shadowheart's thoughts.
Careful that she doesn't take a piece of you as a souvenir.
Ah, sitting. Such an engaging activity.

Not interested in a vampire's leftovers, I'm afraid.
Ugh. Later. Ground's spinning.
Not exactly an ambush for the ages.

I will not go long without pleasure.
For now.

But enough about me. I saw Wyll looking at you. I bet he'd like a word, or more...
I won't keep you long - I gather you've already made plans with someone for your evening.
But nobody's here to debate right from wrong.
I don't know.
Don't get used to it. We just needed to clear the path forward.
I'll find you later, once the camp's asleep.
Maybe those plans could change, for the right person...
True. But I thought you might not want to linger with me. We haven't always seen eye to eye, after all.
Something like that. I was taught to reject anything that distracted from Shar...
If you do that, well... I see no reason why we shouldn't get closer.
There - some liquid courage. And try to get some rest too if you can; tomorrow's another day.
You're putting words in my mouth - I never said I disliked you. It's just we have some work to do, to get on each other's good sides.
I wouldn't quite say that... but no, that's not what I mean.
And yes, I'm sure there's someone out there for you. You should go see who'd like to spend the night with the saviour of the grove...
Another time.
Best enjoyed someplace private, I think.
Far be it from me to judge. Blood must still be running a little hot after everything.
I saw you with Wyll. You two looked... cosy.
Maybe you would. But I'm not cruel enough to get your hopes up. In spite of what some might believe...
Maybe I'd like to celebrate with you...
I already got my answer. Let's not make this awkward.
Not tonight.
I'm not half as mysterious as you might think. Respect my privacy, my beliefs, keep us focused on finding a cure...
Oh you do, do you? I'm not some dewy-eyed tiefling maiden you just saved - you'll need to do a lot more leg-work before I commit to any hip-work.
Enjoy the rest of your night. But maybe do it elsewhere.
Don't forget our little agreement. As soon as things quiet down here...
Just a bottle?
Best not keep me waiting. I'd prefer not to entertain myself...
I will, but not as much as you'll enjoy yours, I'm betting...
It's quite a bottle. I liberated one of the finer vintages earlier.
Your words, not mine. But not what I mean.
...but there'll be time for penance later.
I've arranged some... company, yes. It could be a long evening.

Shar?

Not so much. You spend the whole time avoiding swords and schemes. Plus people just get nastier as the night wears on.
Enjoy the party. And enjoy so-and-so too, while you're at it. For now.
He's a good egg. A little scholarly for my tastes, but I'm sure you could crack his spine like a new book.
All I need now is a fire-retardant lover to get lost in 'til sunrise.
Speaking of possibilities, what's this I've been hearing about you and Astarion?
You. Me. Friends. Got it? Good.
Cheers to you, soldier. And to me, if I do say so myself.
Leave.
Thank you. I know it can't be easy.
High pain tolerance. And a dynamic duo of truly shitty bosses.
Bye, soldier.
Enjoy yourself tonight, Karlach.
Good to see the two of you getting along, anyway. At least one of us is getting a little action.
I know. But you only live once, and if you never throw your dart, you'll never hit the bull's eye.
It isn't hard. And I really like you. I was wrong to go for someone else.
But hey. At least some of us are getting a little action.
It's nice to be somewhere where good is still possible.
She's a funny one. All pointy and secretive, but it seems like there's someone very sweet beneath it all, you know?
I think I've drummed up the courage to tell you how much I like you.
Burn, baby. As hot as I can tolerate. Makes me a beast in battle. Hardly remember what I was like before it.
Thank you for noticing.
Really? I thought - because of you and you know... I don't know, I thought maybe you just wanted to be with someone you could actually be with.
I still want to spend time with you - just the two of us.
I know I was a little hopeless when we - you know - before. I want you to be happy. And I want you to be with someone you can actually be with.
You have a mechanic for your heart?
And with such lovely company.
That's true. And I'm looking forward to spending more time with you.
I just want that to be me. Somehow. Some day.
Gods that's hot. Don't get me started. I might never stop.
Fuck yes! I'm celebrating my freedom. And our friendship. And these folks' bright future besides.
And with good potations, too.
Keep throwing.
Oh god. You know I want that more than fucking anything.
Have fun.
What'll happen if you don't get tuned up?
Take you and Gale, for instance. Don't think I haven't noticed the sparks flying.
I like her, and I bet she's a wildcat after midnight, but I'm just not sure I trust her yet. Mind yourself, all right?
I met someone who might be able to help - a smith who worked in the Hells for a time.
Really? I mean - great!
Hear that? Infernal engine for a heart. Lets me burn as hot as the Hells. Seems to be running in overdrive since I left Avernus.
You too, soldier.
He's a good one. The best, maybe. When I think about what he sacrificed for me... Give him something to smile about, all right?
Well look, soldier, I won't always be too hot for words and deeds. You may regret to find that I happen to be very touch-worthy, underneath the searing, lethal flames.
What does the engine allow you to do?
Then we have you and Wyll, the ultimate incarnation of all things good in the world. There's something between you two, isn't there?
Not if I enjoy you first.
You know there's someone else, Karlach.
Are you enjoying yourself?
Enjoy yourself tonight, Karlach.
I'd understand. I mean, I do understand. I'm not possessive. And at the end of the day, I want you to do what you want to do.
I want to be close to you. Now, ten minutes from now, ten years from now.
I suppose so. But sometimes I feel like I'm stuck in the past.
Speaking of which... there's something I wanted to tell you.
What does the engine allow you to do?
Me too. I don't think I've ever looked forward to anything as much.
Don't look too far back. We only just met.
I appreciate that. But I'm afraid it's a miss this time.
You better go enjoy the party before I do something I'll regret. I like you unburnt, after all.
Perhaps if I manage to break the curse... perhaps then I can show you just how grateful I am.
I think I might be sick beyond the tadpole... I'm getting worried.
There's also the shadow curse - it's an affront and must be cleansed.
Why do you want to go to Moonrise Towers?
Tell me how I can help.
If only everyone said that.
How will the grove fare without you?
Don't get too sentimental - I had need of a guide in order to survive this curse.
She can tend to the grove, help it heal. In time, others will join. Perhaps some day I can return.
The Oak Father must have blessed you to make it this far, or another eye above.
I have to ask - how do you know so much about the parasite?
Perhaps - if we can find Thaniel's lost half, and make him whole again.
I need her to stay focused on her training - the grove will need a skilled healer in my absence.
I found an elevator - but it leads right into the shadow curse.
I'm glad I could help.
Sounds like the grove will be in good hands then.
Keep looking. If they're present, then it's likely there's a route to Moonrise somewhere.
What about one of the others? Rath, perhaps?
Perhaps I could share more than a camp fire and some company...
I knew something was wrong when he didn't wake up, but now I'm even more certain.
Oak father's blessings to you.
We need to find Oliver and get him to return to Thaniel. Otherwise this curse will never be lifted.
No more than my right hand can absorb my left. Oliver is helping Thaniel to recover; they both lie dormant, like trees awaiting spring.
Still feeling at home here with us? The surroundings are less bucolic, I understand...
I met a sort of shadow child before - a little boy named Oliver. Around Thaniel's age.
Won't this cause resentment?
I'm just glad to be out here amidst the Oak Father's creations.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
It's both simple and not - we need to find Thaniel's missing half, and make him whole again.
I'll be ready.
Well if there's anything I can do to make you less comfortable, let me know.
Perhaps... but best to not dwell on nights past. There are plenty more yet to come.
Just try to make yourself useful.
Prudent. But I hope we won't have to contend with the perils of the curse for long. There's more to living than just survival. Much more.
Once the curse is lifted, they can stand as one or as a pair. Whatever they wish.
How're you faring out here at the camp?
Good lass. You're tougher than Blackwood.
Good lad. You're tougher than Blackwood.
I swear I can already feel a change in the air - like the curse itself knows its time is short.
Hideous - but fascinating. Like nothing else in nature, I'm glad to say.
With such stimulating company? Never better.
Seems like you feel responsible for this shadow curse somehow...
You'll find plenty of books before long. I keep coming across them everywhere.
I can't say for certain, but we'll see it come to pass long before this place recedes behind us. Don't worry - all is at hand. We can depart whenever you're ready.
I believe you when you tell me that your symptoms do not wholly align with the makings of the parasite. But until we remove it, I doubt we will be able to isolate the rest of your troubles.
Miss it? Oh dear no. It's a terrible burden; takes you away from nature and forces you to deal with others' problems and personalities.
Resentment will spring up like mushrooms no matter what I do. You cannot please everyone and you'd be a fool to try.
We must find Thaniel. He is the embodiment of nature's power, but... but he is just a child. A child who has been trapped in this place for a hundred years.
In truth, I'm not sure. This is beyond all reckoning. It's still part of Thaniel, deep down, but it may not recognise that, or want to recognise that.
There'll be no firm answers until Moonrise Towers, I fear.
I'd rather the shadow curse didn't linger just beyond the campfire... but your company more than makes up for it.
I'm glad. But let's keep focused at the same time.
But... if I succeed, if I break the curse, then perhaps there will be time for myself again. And for others.
It may prove impossible to avoid the shadow curse entirely, but if you find any way to limit your exposure, seize it.
Black outs, fainting spells. I'm losing new memories every day...
One of those who died had a clue that was supposed to help us find the hidden entrance to the Underdark.
What stayed behind would have been the strongest part of him, but after all these years left in darkness, corruption must have taken hold.
But friendship is no consolation trophy. I cherish the bond we have forged. Whether it should grow into something else is not for me to predict.
There are few things that are too strong for me. And cast those regrets aside; you did not get caught up in the moment - you seized it.
Couldn't Nettie take over?
Indeed, but we cannot yet say the same for you. I promised I would help you, and I intend to keep that promise, however I can.
Aradin was convinced there was a hidden entrance in the temple of Selne - I'd start there.
I've inspected a tadpole up close and seen the effects of them on the Absolute's so-called 'True Souls.'
What about this secret stronghold in the Underdark? You must know more.
If I can join you and get close to Moonrise, perhaps I can lift this curse just as you find a cure for your infection.
You wish to speak?
But in my eagerness, I put far too much faith in the abilities of Aradin and his band. We didn't even get close.
Join me.
I've got more exploring to do.
Is that why you went with Aradin? You thought he might find this route to Moonrise?
By now, we should have seen some small glimmer of Thaniel's power - a sign that the land is healing. New growth, flowers in bloom. But there has been nothing.
Maybe you could show your appreciation another way.
What Ketheric Thorm unleashed is not something that nature can undo by itself. I must do what I can.
What comes next will prove dangerous. Meet me by the shore outside Last Light - we can do our work there without imperilling others.
I wish I could have found another fate for the Grove, but I appreciate all you have done for me nonetheless.
A bad impression? Impossible.
I met a sort of shadow child before - a little boy named Oliver. Around Thaniel's age.
He's still fighting. The curse hasn't won yet, but he'll need our help if he's to recover.
A haunting has come upon you, but the first step is this admission you have now made. You will not walk alone into this night, remember that.
Honestly? Let's just forget it ever happened.
I'm glad to have you.
Thaniel is resting - but it's no easy slumber. I discovered what's wrong with him.
In other circumstances, I would have done the same.
I met a shadow child named Oliver, resembling Thaniel - but he's dead now.
The shadows rended him in two when they bore him away to the Shadowfell. Half of his essence remained here, amidst the curse.
Thaniel rests well. He's healing very rapidly, now that Oliver has returned to him.
Those who remained are shadow-cursed. If you don't die at their hands, then you become one of them.
What should I look for, exactly?
Rath has promise, but he's not ready yet. The grove needs experience and a strong hand.
I studied one up close - closer than most would care to be to those things.
But if we can find him, we can break the curse. If you learn anything of the Shadowfell, or of a boy with the forest in his eyes, find me at once.
Look for signs of life in the darkness. Wildflowers, where everything else is dead. The curse cannot subdue the power Thaniel bears. Not entirely.
What happened to Oliver, exactly? Did Thaniel... absorb him?
Perhaps there's still a way to learn something from him - the dead can't deny their knowledge, if asked the right question.
Those illithid creatures threaten the natural order - it's my duty to do what I can to stop them.
This doesn't have to be your burden alone. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.
And I am glad to be at your side. I just hope an old bear can prove to be of some service to you.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
That sounds like what you need. But the next part of the journey mightn't be straightforward - or safe.
I found the stronghold in the Underdark you mentioned - a place called Grymforge.
The shadow curse is upon us. As foul as I remember it - perhaps even worse.
There is a ruin, some way outside of Last Light. I caught a glimpse of fresh blooms there, but did not investigate further. I shall mark it upon your map.
Don't worry - if you find something, you will know it.
I helped overthrow Ketheric Thorm and his Dark Justiciars years ago. But I failed to prevent him from unleashing darkness across the region before he was defeated.
Try as I may, I cannot stop thinking about death.
What will happen to the grove now?
No, my friend. The only thing I ask of you is to allow me by your side on the road ahead. I still owe you a debt, and I intend to pay.
Perhaps so, or perhaps not. I had wondered if I had detected something else once... but I must have been mistaken - my admiration for you, conflated with other feelings.
And you saw this boy yourself? That can't be a coincidence - but we need to be sure.
A survivor? Silvanus blesses us - this could be just the person we need to speak to.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
Very shrewd of you.
Good. Now our roots can deepen - together.
Seems your ranks are quite packed. If some space frees up, I'll be ready for you.

This land is more than just soil and rock, root and leaf... it is a living being, in the form of a young fey boy, with the forest itself in his eyes. His name is Thaniel - I've met him, in my meditations.
Perhaps not - if he truly is a part of Thaniel, then he is beyond life and death. More likely he's just hiding. We should return to where you saw him.
Leave.
In fact, I saw just the sort before, not long after we first came within reach of the shadow curse. Fool that I am, I did not grasp their significance at the time.
I'll trust your judgement.
The grove needs to move beyond the mistakes of the past. What it needs is an unknown quantity; an outsider who can enforce the Oak Father's teachings without bias.
More good has been done since I met you than in a hundred years before. Words cannot express my gratitude.
Sleepwalking... hallucinating creatures... the temptations... I could lose myself before I make it to a cure.
At the celebration before - I may have came over too strong perhaps. Got caught up in the moment.
I shall do my utmost.
Danger. Are you sure that's the best way to Moonrise?
Is that so? Well, nature does abhor waste... I will keep watch, thank you. I had a feeling time in your company would prove fruitful.
No matter how it's been twisted by the shadows, it is still part of Thaniel's essence - it will resemble him somehow, and may show signs of his power.
A drow attacked me and I defended myself. Afterwards, I was able to examine the tadpole that emerged.
I am here to be your ear, as you bear your burdens, and the arms that protect you, if you can shoulder them no more.
Only, the missing half may not come willingly. The curse will have sunk its tendrils deep, twisting Thaniel's essence into something... else.
I can't be exact, unfortunately. Time and the shadow curse won't have been kind to any traces that would have been left behind.
Once Thaniel's essence is found, what then?
Tread carefully. You're on the right track, I'm sure - but there'll still be danger and difficulty before you reach Moonrise.
I can think of a thing or two... but in truth, it is for the best that the curse consumes my thoughts for now. This is the best chance I've had in a century - I cannot squander it.
You're still faring well at camp, I hope?
Let me help you then. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.
Not what. Who. But all in due course.
You're sending me to look for a needle in a haystack. In the dark.
First and only Druid. What will Francesca even do here?
At the celebration with the tieflings before - I hope I didn't come over too strong. Got caught up in the moment.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
Absolute followers - but that's about all.
I'll see what I can do, but no promises.
But with the Oak Father's blessing, we may soon see it banished from these lands.
A fellow druid. I can count on her to tend to the grove in my absence, help it heal.
It is lost to me - lost to the world. Perhaps there'll be some way to unseal it in the future...
Share what you learned of Thaniel's presence in the Shadowfell.
Friends and nothing more, then?
Perhaps it can be reasoned with, but I'm not hopeful. Reason is not something that thrives amidst the shadow curse.
Still, I would like to return here some day. See Thaniel and Oliver again - in my meditations, or perhaps in person, if the Oak Father wills it. I hope he does.
Well... there's hardly anyone left to share the responsibility with. Few who witnessed the fall of Moonrise still draw breath.
It can't have been easy, surrendering your title. Won't you miss being First Druid?
You're too modest by far. What fate would I have met without you? Rotting in the goblins' cells? Dying against an onslaught on the Grove?
We have to get to Moonrise, but the less time we spend in its blighted surrounds, the better.
You are not bound by social niceties, I see. I like that. Perhaps I can show you just how much, another time.
I'm glad to have you.
Of course. Whatever you wish.
Anyway, once the curse is lifted, nature can take its course without me. I belong at your side.
Who?
Come, I need you by my side out there.
You'd have done the same...?
He is...? Then I must see him. Insensible or not, he knows something.
Who knows what awaits us in the city and beyond, but we shall face whatever may come as staunch allies and unwavering friends.
Leave.
We're in the midst of the shadow curse now. Is there any more you can tell me about how to lift it?
Powerful, certainly. But clearly arrested by magic, too. The question I just can't answer is who has done this. And why?
If you want me, I'm yours. Against the curse, against the Absolute - anything. Just say the word.
This is why I chose Francesca. She will restore simplicity and purity to the grove in my absence.
It's not easy, seeing the ravages of the shadow curse... but your camp is a most welcome solace.
One of his cohorts, a dwarf called Brian, had a clue on his person. If you find his corpse in the goblins' camp, you may have a start.
This 'more' that you want. What is it?
And I'm glad to be had - glad to be with you, I mean.
Put it from your mind for now. Once we near the curse - then there will be more to be said.
Precisely! Who indeed? You do not know, and neither do any of the others.
Bittersweet, that we had to leave Thaniel's realm so soon, after all that was done to save it. But it shall thrive in our absence, and now Baldur's Gate awaits.
Stay here, for now.
His strength is coming back to him. Soon he'll be able to banish the curse once and for all. Until then, we should do what we can to stop the Absolute.
I found a Flaming Fist who escaped the Shadowfell - but he's dead.
Contrary to how some think of us, we druids can play politics when necessary.
Any ideas on how to find this missing half?
It's had the whole region around Moonrise Towers in a chokehold of darkness and despair for years now.
You've shared your fire with me, your company. A small pocket of light against the darkness, but one I couldn't do without. Thank you.
And I truly mean we, if you wish. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.
Turn to other matters.
There's a Flaming Fist at Last Light. The curse has left him insensible, but he's muttering about a boy called Thaniel.
You're right. I'll try to keep it together.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
I'll see what I can find out.
Thaniel still suffers. There'll be no improvement until his essence is restored, I fear.
Hopefully. I've chosen a successor as First Druid - Francesca of the High Forest. I sent a bird to summon her.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
There's nobody in the grove you'd choose?
I will go to see him at once. Join me when you can.
Thaniel is no ordinary child - he is the very spirit of this land. If this Fist knows where he is, then perhaps we can save him... save everything.
I met a shadow child named Oliver, resembling Thaniel - but he's dead now.
No words needed - I understand how you feel.
Poor soul... but in truth, if I had to choose between death and the Shadowfell, I'd choose death.
...Forgive me. Sometimes I forget myself, gazing on the beauty of nature's creations.
I studied the shadow curse for years. But to truly understand it - and stop it - I must reach its source.
Impressive. Most would quake at the mere thought of delving that far into the Underdark. What did you find?
You flirting with me, big man? Why not spare the talk and get straight to the sweaty part?
Leave.
...perhaps not. I do not know. All I can do for now is to try do some good where I can - try to help you.
Yes. I think you do...
You're welcome.
I can think of a thing or two... but the curse grips my mind for now, and I would loathe to give you only part of my attention.
This shadow curse you spoke of... surely it can't be that bad.
No. At least, not right now.
So when will the curse actually be lifted?
You've been researching the illithid parasites - is there anything you can tell me?
How do you know this?
Perhaps, but we'll need to get closer before I can put my theory into practice.
I met a sort of shadow child before - a little boy named Oliver. Around Thaniel's age.
I'm sure something will come to me, given time.
Good - this is what we've been lacking. Now there's a chance we can find Thaniel, and bring him home.
I have. But perhaps there is more that I want...
I'm certain. The Underdark is dangerous, yes, but the alternative is suicide. Be patient and be thorough - the path will reveal itself in time.
Wonderfully! If I'm honest, the grove was too comfortable for my tastes; I felt removed from nature.
Precisely. Then perhaps I could have done something about both the shadow curse and ceremorphosis aberrations.
Oak Father shield you, my friend.
A living witness is unlikely, I'll admit. But perhaps there'll be an unliving witness, or some lingering echo of what we seek.
There's a Flaming Fist recuperating in Last Light. Seems he escaped from the curse - and he spoke of a boy called Thaniel.
I met a shadow child named Oliver, resembling Thaniel - but he's dead now.
Can it be undone?
I'm glad I didn't leave a bad impression then.
Indeed.
...But since the curse was unleashed, I have not felt his presence. He is its prisoner, I fear. And as long as he remains so, his domain will lie in darkness.
How is Thaniel?
I'll miss my books, but I can find all the wisdom they contain out here, first-hand.
All right, leave it to me.
I can only imagine what fate would I have met without you -rotting in the goblins' cells? Being sealed away by the Rite of Thorns for all eternity?
Be wary of anyone who actually wants such a role, I say. Likely they don't understand it, or they have ill intent.
If I had my fleet of druids and a month of hard research, perhaps I could help. But I'm no savant, for now I can only guarantee a cure for ceremorphosis.
These lands must bring back bad memories for you. I hope you're still faring all right with us.
Everything in your mind has been destroyed, from what I gathered. And from the path I see you on, you are doing well at picking up the pieces.
What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
I knew I could put my faith in you. If only we had met sooner.
Precious little, but I'm quite certain it can still be found.
Do you know how the shadow curse can be stopped?
A dwarf called Brian, I believe. Though there's no guarantee that the goblins left him recognisable.
I hope you've no more requests - I need to take care of my own problems.
I hope they will remain as a pair. It would be good for them both to have a friend, once I'm gone.
I heard you learnt how to swim, Shadowheart - well done.
You know, if you and your love ever wish to enjoy the waters with me, I could attempt a kelpie... or even a porpoise.
Depends, are you buoyant? I may need a life preserver if I get in over my head.
What gave it away?
Leave.
You shouldn't do this just because you feel like you owe me something...
A less trusting person might think this all sounds very suspicious.
I only did it to help you get stronger.
You deserve a reward. I am so very pleased with what you gave me.
We could take an evening to ourselves. Get away from camp - get some privacy.
So did I. More than words can say.
A gentleman never tells.
A lady never tells.
You'll never get me to admit it.
Deny your feelings all you like, it doesn't matter to me.
Wonderful. I just hope we don't have to wait too long before we can steal away.
No! It hurt like the hells.
I'm growing to like the whole package, honestly. And you clearly like me too, so...
I died, remember?
What? Was it something I said?
On my honour, the only thing on my mind is depraved, carnal lust.
Oh, that's hardly the only reason. It's more of an excuse if anything.
So let me repay you for your noble sacrifice.
Assuming you want this too, of course. But we both know you do.
Come now, don't be coy. Your body's already given you away.
Ha! Maybe there's more to you than I thought.
Darling, I was just thinking about you.
Remembering our time together, the things we've shared - and I don't just mean that lovely neck of yours.
Yes, I did.
See you there, lover.
I'd rather kiss a leech - they're just as attractive, but take less blood.
Absolutely not.
Then let me make it up to you. You gave me a wonderful gift - it's only fair I return the favour.
Oh you are no fun at all.
That sounds pretty good to me.
Thank goodness we're all such good, trusting friends, then.
I could feel it as I was getting lost in your neck. Your little shakes of excitement.
You don't have to say a thing - I already know how you feel. Because I feel it too.
I know somewhere quiet. Somewhere intimate. Somewhere we can... indulge in each other.
You enjoyed it, didn't you?
But once we can, I promise you a night you'll never forget.
I've already tasted you, and that's all the carnal delight I need.
And look how well it worked! I've never felt better, all thanks to you.
Ha ha - ahem. Don't you worry. It takes years to master the Vollante.
Sorry, but it's a firm 'no' on this one.
You have more control than you give yourself credit for.
Wyll, I'd love nothing more than to dance with you. But I fear I'd burn you to a crisp.
I could try. If you're up for it.
Dance? But there's no music.
Our hearts can keep time.
As luck would have it, she just arrived.
As luck would have it, he just arrived.
As luck would have it, they just arrived.
Perform a simple cadence.
Now perhaps we might try a more - intimate style.
I'm not interested, Wyll.
You don't have to be. Just follow my lead.
Twirl about with flair and abandon.
Bashful tonight, are we? Perhaps you will take to a more - relaxed style.
That sounds wonderful.
Good night. And thank you. For the dance, I mean. I won't forget it.
Gather your strength and leap into the air.
Trust me. I don't think you could fail anyone if you tried.
Smile nervously.
I was hoping we might spend the night... together.
I could really hurt you.
How utterly charming!
Oh goodness. Is it all that bad? I'm dreadfully out of practise.
This has gone too far. I should take my leave.
Oh.
But you won't.
Good night, Wyll.
Bravo. Bravo!
*Sigh.* I've drunk wines from Daggerford to Cormyr, but I've never known a taste as rich as yours.
Move in for another kiss.
Well, not all of us were born with silver spoons in our mouths.
Don't worry. It's not really about the dance. It's about who's we're dancing with.
Well - it's getting late. We can't face the morrow if we don't bid farewell to the now.
A new partner? And who might that be?
Invite him closer with a knowing look - it's what you both want.
You're a beautiful dancer. I'm sure you'll teach me in no time.
I'm ready - let's dance.
No better time to brush up on my skills, then. It would do me no good to fail my new partner.
I'd burn you if I kissed you now, Wyll. No matter how much I want to.
Nice form. Where'd you learn to dance like that?
Good night, then.
Twirl about with flair and abandon.
May I have this dance?
Indeed? Well let's see how you fare with a more - intimate style.
Beats all that fancy flitting around you were doing.
Press your lips against Wyll's.
Don't you worry, you were a joy to witness. But perhaps we might try a more intimate style.
I'm tempted, trust me. I thought my heart might burst with every step.
I'm surprised you'd ask. Thought maybe a part of you was still suspicious of me.
Forgive me. I was... caught up in the moment. But look - not a cinder on me.
I think we should just call it a day.
Cocky, don't you think? Threaten my life, then try to cosy up after?
Turn your head away.
Fair enough. Perhaps a less energetic style would suit you better.
No need to be modest, you were a delight to behold.
I know a few people who might beg to differ. But the only one that matters is here with me now.
I'd like to do this the proper way. The way of the old romances sung by the bards.
Smile and bow.
As charming as that sounds, I don't want to give you the wrong impression.
I've attended my share of fancy balls and masquerades. A few elegant moves can turn all the right heads.
Stay quiet, and watch Wyll dance.
I don't know. I'm not much of a dancer.
I mean - yes, of course. The sun only rests for so long.
Dance with a devil? Most certainly not.
But perhaps we might try a more intimate style.
